headline: Baked Salmon Fillets Dijon
description: Learn how long to bake salmon at 400 degrees F with this easy recipe for delicious salmon fillets coated with Dijon mustard and seasoned bread crumbs.

video.description: This recipe is simple enough for busy weeknights, elegant enough for parties.
video.name: Baked Salmon Dijon

name: Baked Salmon Fillets Dijon
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a shallow baking pan with aluminum foil.

Place salmon fillets skin-side down on the prepared baking pan. Spread a thin layer of mustard on top of each fillet; season with salt and pepper. Top with bread crumbs, then drizzle with melted butter.
Bake in the preheated oven until salmon flakes easily with a fork, about 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This was the best salmon I EVER had! Can't wait to make it again.
Very tasty, moist and flavoursome!
I baked it for about 15 mins then broiled to get the bread crumbs a little crispy. I might add honey to the Dijon next time.
It was easy to make. I used stone ground Dijon so it was a grainier texture, but still tasty. I would make it again.
Absolutely delicious!!

It was soooooooo easy and delicious! This will be my go to recipe forevermore! I made a slight change to recipe 1) no Italian breadcrumbs - made my own using Japanese Panko crumbs, adding dried Tuscan seasoning. 2) baked 10 minutes because my fillets were not very thick.
Delicious, the best salmon I've ever made.
It was excellent! The mustard was a nice change. I used olive oil instead of butter - but everything else was the same.

As written, it was too much Dijon flavor for us - too overwhelming. The only changes I made was to half the recipe and mix the butter with the italian bread crumbs ahead of putting them on the salmon (they browned easily this way). Personally, I loved the bread crumb mix with it. I'm not a big fan of dijon, but have tried it in other recipes and liked it so this was still worth a shot and I think the concept of the recipe is still good. I think I'd like to try it again, but with a little bit of honey mustard mixed with mayo (maybe just 1 tbsp for a full recipe). That might fit our household tastes better.
Love, love, love this!
This is super easy and my husband liked it well enough to eat seconds!
Delicious and easy.
I made this to be dairy- and wheat-free by using a butter substitute and rice crumbs instead of bread crumbs. Everyone still liked it a lot!

Added 2T shredded parmesan and garlic salt to the butter and bread crumbs. Asparagus cooked in the same amount of time and on the same pan. Kids ate a few bites but didn't like the Dijon mustard. Next time I make this I will but something different on theirs.
Made this last night. Perfect. Followed recipe exactly as posted. Couldn’t wait to have left overs for breakfast this morning on toast and cream cheese!! A keeper. Both my husband and I loved it.

I wasn't impressed. I would recommend mixing the melted butter with the breadcrumbs then put it on the fish (like another reviewer suggested). Against my better judgement I just drizzled it over the fish and most of the butter ended up in the baking dish.
Very easy to prepare and very delicious. Will make again.
This was delicious. I took a suggestion and melted the butter on the stove and added the bread crumbs before spreading on the salmon. Even my picky 10 year old that doesn’t like fish gobbled it up.

Simple and good. I used a mustard with blue cheese in it and added a small amount of Dill Weed. All of the flavors complimented each other without overpowering. Put it on Wild Rice with green beans on the side. Fancy and easy.
Been making this four years but put crushed potato chips on top, per a Chef’s Country recipe I read years ago. Delicious either way!!
Very tasty and quick! I combined the melted butter and bread crumbs and then rubbed on to the filets.
Simple and delicious. I'll definitely make it again.
Didn’t have Dijon, so I put a little maple syrup on it. Yum!
Crushed pistachios on top gave it the crunch factor plus an additional flavor. Yum!
Yummy - so good

This was delicious! I tried to follow the recipe exactly but only had bread crumbs with Romano cheese. So I sprinkled some Italian seasoning on the salmon. I melted the butter in the microwave and stirred in the bread crumbs (per previous review suggestions). I baked it for 20 minutes with a couple of minutes on broil at the end of cooking time to toast the topping. My husband and I loved it. I served this with rice pilaf and steamed Brussel sprouts. It was an amazing meal.
Simple and tasty

I’m not a salmon lover, but, my husband is. I try to make it for him a couple of times a month. I saw this recipe and thought I’d give it a try. I didn’t have Dijon mustard, so I made a substitute with 1 Tbsp dry mustard, 1 tsp water, 1tsp, white wine vinegar and 1 Tbsp of mayonnaise. I melted the butter and mixed it with panko breadcrumbs before putting it on the salmon. My husband told me to make it like this from now on.

Delicious and so easy. I took another reviewer's advice and mixed the breadcrumbs with the butter. Great idea, came out nice and crispy. Technically, I used homemade gluten free breadcrumbs and avocado oil (dairy free.) You couldn't tell, it was fantastic.
Delicious! I made it exactly as directly. Will be a regular.
This tastes very good but it is pretty soggy. Would be better if it was drier.
So good! I cut this down to 4 servings. I was out of Italian breadcrumbs so add 1 TBLS. of Italian Seasoning. I was also out of Dijon mustard so used yellow mustard and it worked ok.

This is a simple dish that takes no more than 5 minutes to prepare! I baked it for about 20 minutes because my fillets were a bit on the thick side. The result was melt in your mouth good and packed with flavor.
My husband tolerates eating salmon but when I fixed this dish, he said, "You can make this any time!"
So delicious! 15 minutes is accurate. I used a grilling pan in thenoven with aluminum foil and canola oil spray. Just perfect!
very moist and the mustard added a nice touch

The best salmon recipe I’ve tried yet. I’ve made this 5-10 times at least and after the first time I did change a few things. I melt the butter, brush on a thin coat (over salt/pepper), then the mustard, then I mix the rest of the butter into the bread crumbs and pack it on. This is a lot faster/easier for me and I’ve never had a problem with the bread crumbs getting soggy. Tonight, we were out of mustard so I mixed “Chef Paul Blackened Redfish Magic Seasoning Blend” into the panko crumbs and it turned out very bit as good so I might try others.
Good !!!
Excellent. I added a little soy Worcester sauce and used Panko instead. Cooked in my air fryer. Came out great.
I served this dish over a bed of rice. It was delicious
Made it as directed. The strong, tangy mustard overwhelms the subtle flavour of the salmon. Will not be making this again.
This was a amazing. I just modified for the # of servings and used Panko because that’s what I had on hand. Loved it!!

This is a wonderful recipe and the oven temp and time cook the fish beautifully. If you cook it a smidge linger the bread crumbs get even crispier (if you’re into that). I give it four stars simply because the recommended amount of Dijon is a looooooot. I would advise using less on the fish.

Followed someone else's suggestion of melting butter in the pan (cut it down to 1/2 of the recommended amount) and mixing with the bread crumbs before baking (then broiling at the end for 1 minute to get more crispy crumbs). Turned out amazing! Maybe would cut down on the amount of dijon mustard a little bit.

Soooo, I did not have breadcrumbs. I crushed some Texas Toast croutons, the rest I made according to the recipe and review tip to broil for two minutes. I'm not a fan of salmon but this made me a believer. Everyone went for seconds! It's a keeper. Thanks Christy J!
This was very good. I made it exactly as the recipe is. I will definitely make it again.
My family loves this. Thank you for a great and easy recipe

This was so quick and easy I couldn’t pass it up. I used a spicy Dijon mustard, then sprinkled with a garlic pepper salt. Topped that with panko, sprinkled a little crushed red pepper on that and drizzled with olive oil. Baked for 15min and broiled for 2. It was very good.

The breadcrumb topping would work better if you mix the breadcrumbs and butter together before topping the fish with it. Otherwise, the butter tends to roll off the breadcrumbs instead of being absorbed by them.

This was a fantastic recipe and enjoyed by my family that is normally picky when it comes to fish. I did not have Italian Bread Cumbs so I used Planko bread crumbs. In addition, I followed a suggestion to soak the crumbs in the butter which worked out well. I also used a touch of Old Bay seasoning which gave it a little kick. I'll be making this again but will reduce the butter by half to reduce calories and the butter taste.

This was excellent! I didn't have pecans so I used crushed walnuts. The topping was crunchy and even the bottom a bit sweet and crispy. I'll make this again. Not a fan of salmon before. All it took was a new adventure.

This was fantastic. I followed the suggestion of another reviewer and melted the butter in a pan with the bread crumbs in it to evenly distribute the butter, then rubbed the buttered bread crumbs onto the mustard covered salmon. 

This was one of the best salmon dishes I have ever had.
This is a solid and easy recipe. Wonderful taste!
I made it with balsamic dressing instead of mustard. Deliciousss.
This was delicious! Really quick to make and with very few ingredients. The only change I made was used store-bought stuffing mix to use in place of bread crumbs (that way they are already seasoned!)
Delicious and so easy! Great for a quick and yummy weeknight meal. Even my 4yr old loved it!
We love this recipe! Simple, and delicious!
made this many of times we absolutely love it
We love eating salmon and this recipe didn’t disappoint. Serve with jasmine rice and roasted asparagus and you have yourself a restaurant quality meal.
So simple and delicious! Definitely making again!

This is a great way to make salmon. Everyone who has tried it ( and that is about the entire fam) loved it. Easy and tasty 
!!
I have made this several times and it was a real hit. My only change was to add 1/2 c of crushed pecans into the breadcrumbs (I used Panko). It gives an even better crunch.
Simple and delicious
I well make it again, it was good, maybe not great but good!
I used frozen filets, defrosted them, and it was still delicious.
I have made this multiple times. It is my new favorite way to cook salmon. It is quick, easy and very tasty.
Very easy and tasty! Made exactly as written except substituted crushed Ritz crackers for breadcrumbs (I didn’t have on hand). Will definitely make again.
Really, really good!
Delish. I did the melted butter & breadcrumbs combo. Added slivered almonds. Baked for 22 mins b/c it was a thick cut of king salmon. Broiler for browning & crispy topping. Mouth watering good.
I add 1 clove of garlic to the mustard. Then I add about 1/2 of shredded cheese (I like mozzarella the best) the the breadcrumb mixture. Adding these makes a huge difference.
Our favourite way to make salmon!
Delicious. I made it according to recipe but used Panko bread crumbs. I did not add salt, but admit that we salted it at the table. Served with a salad and baked potatoes, cleanup was quick and easy.

I will be making this again. Like others I changed a few small things. Olive Oil instead of Butter, doubled the mustard, mixed Dijon & delicatessen style together (only because I had that on hand, you can use any) Used panko and cooked for 12 minutes. Hubby loved it
perfectly delicious
I will make it again. I would use less Dijon. I might have put too much on.
I don’t like salmon but my husband said it was good. He’s always looking for recipes and tries different ones and this was a keeper.

Lovely way to make salmon! I did use the melting butter and mixing breadcrumbs, before adding to top salmon. It was abosultely delicious. I love fish, so this will be something I use on other fish as well. But salmon is so healthy:) We enjoyed this enormously.

This recipe has converted me to a fish person! I used crispy onions, that I mash up, instead of bread crumbs. And I added some lemon juice to the mustard. Delicious with some zucchini and squash baked right along side of the fish.
I have never baked salmon this way. wasn't sure my husband would like it with the Dijon mustard. We both loved it and was so easy.

I pretty much followed the recipe. I used enough Dijon to coat each fillet. The one change I made was to spray the fillet with cooking spray after I applied the Panko bread crumbs. They browned nicely.
Turned out quite good. I would make this again.
Loved it so much! So did them family. The dijon mustard made me feel so classy lol love it

This was very good, and easy to make. The salmon was cooked perfectly. The salmon with dijon mustard is a great marriage. Actually it was not enough mustard for me so I put a little on my plate to dip the salmon in. I used honey dijon mustard. Will make again.
9-1-19.. I made this again with a few changes. I spread some honey on the fish, THEN I spread on the Dijon mustard. After the 15 minutes was up, I put it under the broiler fo 2 min to put a crust on the topping. This was really good!
Delicious! Didn't change a thing!

My husband loved it! I had to substitute unseasoned breadcrumbs but shook a little italian seasoning over each filet and put a dollop of butter in top of each to melt and flow down to the pan. Tasted great!
Whole family loved it! Real quick way to make "mock" deep fried salmon. Might experiment around with other fish and other flavors.
Made it for company. Served it will filled jasmine rice. It was very good and moist. I forgot the aluminum foil lining. Don’t do that.

I liked that this recipe was so easy - I am no great cook, and probably why it didn’t turn out as well as I had hoped. It was a little overcooked and I think I should not have used all the butter. I will definitely try the recipe again, but next time I will season the salmon with salt and pepper first before spreading the mustard on top. I will also try reducing cooking time to 12-13 minutes, as I do like it a little bit pink; and I will use a little less better.

This salmon was absolutely divine! I had 2 thick salmon fillets that I seasoned with s&p and brushed with Dijon Mild & Creamy Mustard. I combined Italian Panko bread crumbs and melted butter (per a reviewer); then baked them at 375 for 20 min. in my toaster oven. YUMMO! I will definitely be making these again.
I didn't have cilantro but it was good still.

I made this for my family but unfortunately I was out of Dijon mustard so I substituted a gourmet garlic mustard that I had purchased at a fair and the flavor was amazing! I still sprinkled a little salt and pepper on it but everyone loved the flavor. Not overpowering but just enough to enhance the flavor of the salmon.
Fast and easy. I used no skin salmon and no foil in the bottom of the glass baking dish I used. I cooked the fish for 18 min in the oven, Perfect!
My first time making Salmon fillets and I will be making this again. It is delicious and easy.
I didn't have bread crumbs so I used tortia chips. I added pepper and garlic and parmesan cheese too.

This was amazing! Our absolute new favorite way to eat salmon. I had a 1.7 lb long single piece of fish, so I doubled the toppings, skipping the salt since we are trying to be lower sodium - it truly wasn't missed. I melted a whole stick of butter in a small bowl in the microwave, then added all the other ingredients (mustard too!), along with some garlic, basil, oregano, and parsley since my bread crumbs were unseasoned. Topped the salmon entirely, and baked the 16 minutes at 400 degrees, top rack, and checked. The thicker side of the salmon needed more cooking, so I flipped the foil over to cover (without touching foil to fish) the skinny side and stuck it back in the oven for about 7 more minutes. Perfection! Thanks for this great recipe! P.S. it's even better the next day.
Simple, delicious, quick, and easy. Would gladly make again.
Great, easy recipe. Used regular yellow mustard instead of Dijon. Also used some Old Bay seasoning too.

This has become a regular rotation meal for my wife and I and a favorite way to make salmon. We often grill salmon with dill, a taste that goes great with salmon, but nothing compares to how well mustard accents the flavor of salmon. It's also way easier to bake the salmon than to grill it. I use an instant read thermometer and take it out at around 125° and let the carry over temp finish the cooking. Five stars all day long
This was pretty good. I made exactly as recipe stated. I think maybe a little bit of lemon juice to the butter might have added enough spark to make it a five star.
